attributes.action: make Dementia a qualifying criteria for water rate capping
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Currently Dementia is not a condition which qualifies as one that requires the use of extra water to enable the household to register for water rate capping. 
Extra water is required for numerous reasons which include (but not exhaustive):
Extra washing of personal and bed clothes
Frequent use of Toilet
Frequent use of Bath/Shower

government_responses.details:
You signed a petition asking the Prime Minister to "make Dementia a qualifying criteria for water rate capping."

The Prime Minister's Office has responded to that petition and you can view it here: 

http://www.number10.gov.uk/Page20161
